newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - SOUTH KOREAN NEWSPAPERS - AUG 14.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - SOUTH KOREAN NEWSPAPERS - AUG 14.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.
- Seoul Mayor Cho Soon declared he is seeking to run in the December presidential elections on the ticket of the smallest opposition Decomocratic Party.
- The central bank's preferential low-interest loans and other special measures may be mobilized to prop up the plummeting credit rating of Korea First Bank and other domestic banks.
- The bodies of 10 vicitms, recovered from the Korean Air Lines jet accident in Guam, were brought to Seoul on Wednesday for the first time since the crash last week.
- The government has decided to seize Japanese and Chinese boats engaged in fishing illegally within the 200-mile Exclusive Economic Zone and release the violators only when fines are paid.

- Visiting American Congressmen said that the U.S. Congress will adopt a resolution next week to demand that food aid be distributed by non-governmental organizations, not by the North Korean government.
